intro: Greigia columbiana var. columbiana, commonly known as the Columbian greigia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
